00040 #ifndef _CameraManager_h
00041 #define _CameraManager_h
00042 
00043 #include "crossplatformexport.h"
00044 #include "managerbase.h"
00045 #include "quaternion.h"
00046 #include "ray.h"
00047 #include "vector3.h"
00048 
00049 #include <map>
00050 
00051 namespace Ogre
00052 {
00053     class Camera;
00054     class SceneNode;
00055     class Viewport;
00056 }
00057 
00058 namespace phys
00059 {
00060     class Camera;
00061     class SceneManager;
00062     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00063     /// @class CameraManager
00064     /// @headerfile cameramanager.h
00065     /// @brief This is the manager class for all camera functions.
00066     /// @details This class contains all the functionality of the use and manipulation of the camera. @n
00067     /// All functions that manipulate the camera will default to the default camera, so if you only use
00068     /// one camera you should never have to name the camera you want to use. @n
00069     /// This class should only be created after the SceneManager has been created.
00070     ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00071     class PHYS_LIB CameraManager : public ManagerBase {
00072         protected:
00073             friend class World;
00074             friend class Camera;
00075             std::map< String, Ogre::Viewport* > Viewports;
00076             phys::SceneManager* SManager;
00077             Camera* DefaultCamera;
00078             std::vector< Camera* > Cameras;
00079             Camera* FindCamera(String Name);
00080         public:
00081             /// @brief Class Constructor.
00082             /// @details This is the class constructor.  This is automatcally called in the World.CreateRenderWindow()
00083             /// function and should never need to be called manually.
00084             /// @param SceneManagerName Name of the created SceneManager for this camera manager to use.
00085             /// @param SManager A pointer to the Scenemanager where you will be creating/manipulating all the cameras.
00086             CameraManager(Whole SceneManagerIndex);
00087             /// @brief Class Destructor.
00088             /// @details The calss Destuctor
00089             virtual ~CameraManager();
00090             /// @brief Creates (or recreates) the default camera for this manager.
00091             /// @details If this function is called while there is a valid default camera already created, it will delete that camera.
00092             /// @return Returns a pointer to the created camera.
00093             Camera* CreateDefaultCamera();
00094             /// @brief Gets the default camera if it has been initialized.
00095             /// @return Returns the Default Camera or a null point if it hasn't been created yet.
00096             Camera* GetDefaultCamera();
00097             /// @brief Creates a camera and returns a pointer.
00098             /// @details This function does the same as the other CreateCamera function but will also return a pointer to
00099             /// the camera class instead of a string(being the name of the camera).
00100             Camera* CreateCamera(const String& Name);
00101             /// @brief Gets an already created camera by namr.
00102             /// @return Returns a pointer to the camera of the specified name.
00103             Camera* GetCamera(const String& Name);
00104             /// @brief Gets an already created camera by index.
00105             /// @return Returns a pointer to the camera at the specified index.
00106             Camera* GetCamera(Whole Index);
00107             /// @brief Gets the number of cameras created and stored in this manager.
00108             /// @return Returns the number of cameras this manager is storing.
00109             Whole GetNumCameras();
00110             /// @brief Deletes all cameras except for the first camera.
00111             /// @details This will clear the container of cameras.  The default camera is not stored in this container
00112             /// however, so it is spared from this wipe.
00113             void ClearCameras();
00114             /// @brief Creates an additional Viewport within the set render window.
00115             /// @details Like cameras, by default there is one veiwport already made when this class is made, called DefaultViewport.
00116             /// @param Name The name of the new veiwport.
00117             /// @param VeiwportCam The camera that is to be attached to this Viewport.
00118             void CreateViewport(const String& Name, Camera* ViewportCam);
00119 
00120             //Inherited From ManagerBase
00121             /// @brief Empty Initializor
00122             /// @details This specific initializor is unneeded, but we implement it for compatibility. It also exists
00123             /// in case a derived class wants to override it for some reason
00124             virtual void Initialize();
00125 
00126             /// @brief Empty MainLoopItems
00127             /// @details This class implements this for the sake of entension and compatibility this function does nothing
00128             virtual void DoMainLoopItems();
00129 
00130             /// @brief This returns the type of this manager.
00131             /// @return This returns ManagerTypeName::CameraManager
00132             virtual ManagerTypeName GetType() const;
00133 
00134             /// @brief Gets the internal Ogre viewport.
00135             /// @return Returns the Ogre viewport of the specified name.
00136             Ogre::Viewport* GetOgreViewport(const String& Name);
00137     };
00138 }//phys
00139 #endif
